Have COVID symptoms or just want to get tested? Skagit Health has the following set up. It's no cost, if you have insurance they pay (no copay) and if you don't have insurance the state pays.

Here’s the basic information:

· The site is open 9 a.m. -4 p.m., Monday through Friday.

·Skagit Valley College parking lot, open 9am-4pm, M-F

· They are testing anyone over the age of seven who meets the following categories:

o Any member of the public who has mild symptoms of COVID-19 – such as cough and/or fever, new loss of taste or smell, chills, muscle pain or headache OR has had symptoms

· You do not have to register in advance for an appointment.

· Bring an ID card and insurance card with you.

https://www.skagitcounty.net/Departments/HealthDiseases/coronavirusdriveup.htm

EARLY RELEASE!

The winter storm came faster than expected. We normally would not have an unplanned early release, but with the weather and road conditions we feel this is will be the safest way to get students home. We have checked some of the bus routes and they are already becoming packed with snow and ice.

We will dismiss school today at 1:45 to ensure we can get students home safely. If you have the ability to pickup your children early, you may do so at any time.

If your child rides the bus and you will NOT have someone home to be with them you can change their routine in pickup patrol and give us an estimated time you will pick them up or you can call the school and let us know.

We will keep them here until you can pick them up. If we haven’t heard from you we will take them home, if no one is home when the bus goes by we will bring them back to the school and contact you so you can pick them up here.

Basketball Practice is canceled and the Family Ball will be rescheduled.

All buses are on Snow Routes.

Attention ALL "Dads" of Conway Students!

Fathers and Father-figures

On Friday, November 16th from 8:45-9:45 we will have our 1st annual Dads and Donuts event at our school. We will meet in the Conway School cafeteria for free donuts and coffee. Throughout the hour, we will have a presentation about our WATCH D.O.G.S. (Dads Of Great Students) Program. This is a program in schools all across America which helps them to be positively impacted by the committed involvement of fathers and father-figures in their students life.

The goal is to have you spend at least one day this year at the school and be a positive male role model and provide an extra set of eyes and ears.

Dads, grandpas, uncles, step-dads, etc....This is your chance to have some special time with your student in a fun atmosphere at school.

Mark your calendar for November 16th at 8:45. We hope to see you there.

STEAM for All Students!
Science, Technology, Engineering, Art, Math

We have been working on problem and solution for the last couple of weeks and some students who come to me for services embarked on a problem-solving journey to provide Keb, a hermit crab, with a shell.

If you haven't read the riveting AtoZ book, Keb Needs a Shell, it is about a rotund hermit crab who can't find a shell to fit him. By the end of the book, he finds a blue boot with spacious accommodations and ample protection from swooping predators.

I challenged these students to make their own protective shells for Keb. I gave each of them a wax cup to represent Keb's body and provided them with paper plates, cardboard, tape, glue, pipe cleaners and, of course, googly eyes as materials from which to choose to make their own protective shell. The mission was to protect Keb so the stronger the shell the better!

I wanted to share a video of the different ways they made their shells. They are all different, creative and protect Keb from birds of prey. I am very proud of them!

– State Earthquake drill – October 20th @ 10:20. This week, our teachers talked with classes about earthquake drills and participating in the State Earthquake Drill. In the event of any real emergency at Conway School, our County Emergency Management personnel will join with administration at Conway to respond. This is the year we are revisiting our Emergency Response Plan.

October 14th, Skagit Emergency Management toured our campus and made some recommendations for possible updates. For the time being, if there were to be an emergency on campus, law enforcement will close down our campus. Parents will not be able to come directly on campus. We will communicate throughout Skyward e-mail system and this Facebook page.

post_text: Middle School staff has focused this year on teaching middle school students the 21st century skills necessary to be successful in high school and beyond. One of the activities created by the team is monthly spirit assemblies that have the theme of the month, recognition of students, and usually something crazy and fun. This month, there is a presentation on Martin Luther King, Jr. and a contest between the principal/superintendent and the district admin assistant/business manager. Kudos to our middle school team for the work they are doing to meet the needs of our kids! Here are a few of the videos from today's fun activities!
